title: Pandas: Boolean Filtering
story: Filter rows based on conditions. Boolean indexing is one of the most powerful features in Pandas for data analysis.
instructions: Filter the DataFrame to show only rows where age > 25. Print the filtered result.
starterCode:
import pandas as pd

data = {
    'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie', 'David'],
    'age': [23, 28, 32, 25]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Filter where age > 25
filtered = df[df['age'] > 25]
print(filtered)
solutionHidden:
import pandas as pd

data = {
    'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie', 'David'],
    'age': [23, 28, 32, 25]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
filtered = df[df['age'] > 25]
print(filtered)

tests.description: Should filter and show Bob and Charlie (ages 28 and 32)

hints.text: Use df[df['column'] > value] to filter rows.
The condition df['age'] > 25 creates a boolean mask, then df[mask] filters rows.
